intro: Dysoxylum gjellerupii, commonly known as the Kauri fig, is a tropical tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and smooth, grey bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
